tourBios.curYearHigh: Birdied his first five holes and four of his last five in the third round of the Frys.com Open en route to a 9-under 63, his career-low score in relation to par. Struggled Sunday, recording a 2-over 74 to finish T10 with six others at 11-under 277 in the season's first event...Finished T10 at the Sanderson Farms Championship in a Monday finish due to weather...Coming off missed cuts in his last two starts, fired four rounds in the 60s at the CareerBuilder Challenge to finish T3. Played his final round with Phil Mickelson who also finished T3.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Finished the season making 13 cuts in 25 starts, highlighted by two top-10s, which included a dramatic run in the season's finale. Led the Tour in Total Eagles, with 17...Fired a 6-under 64 in the first round of the Panama Claro Championship and grabbed a share of the lead to begin the year. Rounds of 74-77 the next two days dropped him down the list to a T56 finish...Posted four sub-par scores at the South Georgia Classic, where he finished T5 to earn his first career top-10...Was 86th in earnings entering the final Regular Season event, the Cox Classic, where he opened with rounds of 63-68-67-72 to move to 70th and into the Finals...Missed the first three cuts in the Finals only to snare a T6 at the season-ending Web.com Tour Championship to leap from T116 in the priority ranking at the beginning of the week to 32nd, punching his ticket to the 2013-14 PGA TOUR.

2012: Made the cut in two of four Web.com Tour starts and had a T13 finish at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open, where he was a Monday qualifier...Also qualified for the WNB Golf Classic and the Neediest Kids Championship. 

2011: Missed the cut in his first career start on the PGA TOUR, the Zurich Classic of New Orleans where he was a Monday qualifier. Made two cuts in three starts on the Web.com Tour and had a pair of top-25 finishes.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won two individual state championships at Episcopal High School in Baton Rouge...Earned all-state honors in basketball twice and was invited to the Louisiana All-Star Game...Was a two-time All-American at LSU, was named to the All-SEC team as a freshman and was on the All-SEC Honor Roll all four years at LSU.
tourBios.personal: Favorite golf memory is shooting a 64 to get to final stage of the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament in 2012...Never travels without music...Favorite college team is LSU, and favorite pro team is the New Orleans Saints...Would most like to be featured in Field and Stream...Earned all-state honors in basketball twice and was invited to the Louisiana All-Star game (didn't play due to injury). Baton Rouge's The Advocate named him its High School Athlete of the Year as a junior in 2006. Averaged 21.6 points per game during his senior season and holds Episcopal High School's all-time record for three-pointers in a season.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Birdied his first five holes and four of his last five in the third round of the Frys.com Open en route to a 9-under 63, his career-low score in relation to par. Struggled Sunday, recording a 2-over 74 to finish T10 with six others at 11-under 277 in the season's first event...Finished T10 at the Sanderson Farms Championship in a Monday finish due to weather...Coming off missed cuts in his last two starts, fired four rounds in the 60s at the CareerBuilder Challenge to finish T3. Played his final round with Phil Mickelson who also finished T3.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Made the cut in five of 15 PGA TOUR starts, with lone top-10 of the season (T6) coming at the Barbasol Championship in Alabama on the RTJ Golf Trail. Went on to finish the season No. 198 in the FedExCup standings...Played five Web.com Tour Regular Season events, making three cuts which resulted in finishes of T14, T22 and T23...Opened the Web.com Tour Finals with T22 and T53 finishes in Fort Wayne and Charlotte. Then earned his first career Tour win at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship, the penultimate event in the Web.com Tour Finals. Opened with an even-par 71 and was four back after the first round. Maintained pace with the leaders after a second-round 70. Fired 68 on Saturday, birdieing the final two holes to pull within three of Roberto Castro. On Sunday, made three birdies and three bogeys going out. Took the outright lead with a birdie at No. 14. Finished the tournament at 5-under 279, good for a two-stroke victory. His 279 was the highest score of the year (both aggregate and relative to par). Moved up to No. 3 in the Finals' standings with one event to go after collecting a $180,000 first-place check. A T35 at the Web.com Tour Championship placed him eighth in the final priority-ranking order.

2013-14: Rookie season defined by 10 made cuts in 22 starts, three of which resulted in top-25 finishes. Closed the season ranked 137th in the FedExCup standings...After missing the cut in his first five starts of the season, fired a bogey-free, 8-under 63 at Monterey Peninsula CC in the first round of the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am. Ensuing rounds of 73-76-73 resulted in T27 honors...Held the first-round Valero Texas Open lead, with a 5-under 67. Ensuing rounds of 70-70-75 resulted in a T4 with Matt Kuchar. Overcame a 4-over 40 on the outward nine Sunday, with a 1-under 35 to claim his first career top-10 finish...Attempted to regain exempt status on the PGA TOUR via the Web.com Tour Finals but was unable to gain momentum from a T14 finish at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship, missing the cut in the season-ending Web.com Tour Championship.

2013: Finished the season making 13 cuts in 25 starts, highlighted by two top-10s, which included a dramatic run in the season's finale. Led the Tour in Total Eagles, with 17...Fired a 6-under 64 in the first round of the Panama Claro Championship and grabbed a share of the lead to begin the year. Rounds of 74-77 the next two days dropped him down the list to a T56 finish...Posted four sub-par scores at the South Georgia Classic, where he finished T5 to earn his first career top-10...Was 86th in earnings entering the final Regular Season event, the Cox Classic, where he opened with rounds of 63-68-67-72 to move to 70th and into the Finals...Missed the first three cuts in the Finals only to snare a T6 at the season-ending Web.com Tour Championship to leap from T116 in the priority ranking at the beginning of the week to 32nd, punching his ticket to the 2013-14 PGA TOUR.

2012: Made the cut in two of four Web.com Tour starts and had a T13 finish at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open, where he was a Monday qualifier...Also qualified for the WNB Golf Classic and the Neediest Kids Championship. 

2011: Missed the cut in his first career start on the PGA TOUR, the Zurich Classic of New Orleans where he was a Monday qualifier. Made two cuts in three starts on the Web.com Tour and had a pair of top-25 finishes. 

Amateur: Won two individual state championships at Episcopal High School in Baton Rouge...Was a two-time All-American at LSU, was named to the All-SEC team as a freshman and was on the All-SEC Honor Roll all four years at LSU.

Baton Rouge's The Advocate named him its High School Athlete of the Year as a junior in 2006. Averaged 21.6 points per game during his senior season and holds Episcopal High School's all-time record for three-pointers in a season.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T3rd at the CareerBuilder Challenge in partnership with the Clinton Foundation.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T13th in Driving Distance - Driver on the PGA TOUR.
